intro: Tithymalus velenovskyi, commonly known as the Velenovsky's tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
